title: State Capitals Recall
description: How well do you know the capital cities of U.S. states?

questions.question: What is the capital of California?
questions.explanation: Sacramento is the capital of California. Despite Los Angeles being the largest city, Sacramento has been the state capital since 1854.

questions.question: What is the capital of Texas?
questions.explanation: Austin is the capital of Texas. It was named after Stephen F. Austin, known as the 'Father of Texas.'

questions.question: What is the capital of New York?
questions.explanation: Albany is the capital of New York. Although New York City is the largest city, Albany has served as the state capital since 1797.

questions.question: What is the capital of Florida?
questions.explanation: Tallahassee is the capital of Florida. It was chosen as the capital in 1824 because of its central location between the two major cities of the time.

questions.question: What is the capital of Illinois?
questions.explanation: Springfield is the capital of Illinois. It is also famous as the hometown of Abraham Lincoln before he became president.

questions.question: What is the capital of Pennsylvania?
questions.explanation: Harrisburg is the capital of Pennsylvania. It sits on the Susquehanna River and has been the capital since 1812.

questions.question: What is the capital of Oregon?
questions.explanation: Salem is the capital of Oregon. It became the capital when Oregon achieved statehood in 1859.

questions.question: What is the capital of Louisiana?
questions.explanation: Baton Rouge is the capital of Louisiana. The name means 'red stick' in French, referring to a cypress tree that marked the boundary between two tribal territories.

questions.question: What is the capital of Montana?
questions.explanation: Helena is the capital of Montana. It was founded as a gold camp in 1864 and became the state capital in 1875.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kentucky?
questions.explanation: Frankfort is the capital of Kentucky. It is one of the smallest state capitals in the U.S., with a population of about 28,000.

questions.question: What is the capital of South Dakota?
questions.explanation: Pierre is the capital of South Dakota. It is the second least populous state capital in the U.S. and is named after Pierre Chouteau Jr., a fur trader.

questions.question: What is the capital of Vermont?
questions.explanation: Montpelier is the capital of Vermont. With a population of about 8,000, it is the least populous state capital in the United States.

questions.question: What is the capital of Missouri?
questions.explanation: Jefferson City is the capital of Missouri, named after President Thomas Jefferson. It is situated along the Missouri River.

questions.question: What is the capital of New Hampshire?
questions.explanation: Concord is the capital of New Hampshire. The New Hampshire State House, built in 1819, is the oldest state house in which the legislature still meets in its original chambers.

questions.question: What is the capital of Nevada?
questions.explanation: Carson City is the capital of Nevada. It was named after the famous frontiersman Kit Carson and has been the capital since Nevada became a state in 1864.
